results:
Based on my search results for Polish editions of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" by Mark Twain published by PIW and Nasza Księgarnia, I can provide you with the following information:

The first Polish edition of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" was published in 1901, and the work has been continuously available in Polish translation since then.

From the search results, I can identify several Polish publishers that have released editions of "Przygody Tomka Sawyera":

**Wydawnictwo Greg** appears to be one of the most prominent publishers offering this title:
- They published a version in the "Kolorowa Klasyka" (Colorful Classics) series, which is described as "the most beautiful colored edition of this novel on the market" with wonderful, colorful illustrations and large, easy-to-read font on noble paper, very durable and aesthetic
- This edition contains the full text of the work without cuts or abridgements in content, but does not include study materials

**Other publishers mentioned** in the search results include various bookstores and educational publishers, but I did not find specific information about **PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy)** or **Nasza Księgarnia** editions in these particular search results.

The novel was originally published in 1876 in English as "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer", and it remains a school reading assignment that new generations read with delight.

While I found extensive information about various Polish editions of this classic work, I wasn't able to locate specific details about the PIW and Nasza Księgarnia editions you asked about in these search results. You may want to check directly with those publishers' catalogs or contact them for more specific information about their editions of this title.
